title: How to Finish Seams on Soft Toys

steps.headline: Select a colour of thread that matches the fabric as closely as possible.
steps.description: Prefer lighter thread if you cannot match exactly. Once stuffed, the seam thread will show.

steps.headline: Use thread that is strong and durable.
steps.description: This is especially important for toys that will be played with and moved about a lot.

steps.headline: Sew using a strong stitch.
steps.description: Double stitch tight corners and pressure points to avoid accidental loosening or fraying from occurring. There is nothing worse than the stuffing popping out unexpectedly!

steps.headline: Use back stitch at the beginning and end of each seam.
steps.description: Alternatively, tie off the ends of the thread for each seam end very tightly. The aim is to ensure that the seams will not unravel.
